definition: direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes, the act of drawing or hauling something
details:
verb
- direct toward itself or oneself by means of some psychological power or physical attributes
= synonyms: pull in
- take in, also metaphorically
= synonyms: suck, take in, take up, absorb, soak up, imbibe, suck up, sop up
- make a mark or lines on a surface
= example: make a mark or lines on a surface
= synonyms: line, delineate, trace, describe
- earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher
= synonyms: get
- engage in drawing
= example: engage in drawing
- represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
- write a legal document or paper
= example: write a legal document or paper
- elicit responses, such as objections, criticism, applause, etc.
- take liquid out of a container or well
= synonyms: take out
- bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
= example: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
= synonyms: pull
- move or go steadily or gradually
- cause to flow
= synonyms: flow
- cause to move in a certain direction by exerting a force upon, either physically or in an abstract sense
= synonyms: pull
- get or derive
= synonyms: reap
- remove (a commodity) from (a supply source)
= synonyms: withdraw, take out, draw off
- pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
= example: pull (a person) apart with four horses tied to his extremities, so as to execute him
= synonyms: quarter, draw and quarter
- require a specified depth for floating
= example: require a specified depth for floating
- allow a draft
= example: allow a draft
- cause to localize at one point
- flatten, stretch, or mold metal or glass, by rolling or by pulling it through a die or by stretching
= example: flatten, stretch, or mold metal or glass, by rolling or by pulling it through a die or by stretching
- remove the entrails of
= example: remove the entrails of
= synonyms: eviscerate, disembowel
- steep
- reduce the diameter of (a wire or metal rod) by pulling it through a die
= example: reduce the diameter of (a wire or metal rod) by pulling it through a die
- contract
= synonyms: catch
- bring or lead someone to a certain action or condition
= example: bring or lead someone to a certain action or condition
- select or take in from a given group or region
= example: select or take in from a given group or region
- make, formulate, or derive in the mind
= example: make, formulate, or derive in the mind
= synonyms: make
- give a description of
= synonyms: describe, depict
- choose at random
= example: choose at random
= synonyms: cast
- finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.
= synonyms: tie
- suck in or take (air)
= example: suck in or take (air)
= synonyms: drag
- pass over, across, or through
= synonyms: pass
- move or pull so as to cover or uncover something
= example: move or pull so as to cover or uncover something
- stretch back a bowstring (on an archer's bow)
= example: stretch back a bowstring (on an archer's bow)
= synonyms: pull back
- thread on or as if on a string
= synonyms: string, thread
- cause to move by pulling
= example: cause to move by pulling
= synonyms: pull
noun
- the act of drawing or hauling something
= synonyms: haulage
- poker in which a player can discard cards and receive substitutes from the dealer
= example: poker in which a player can discard cards and receive substitutes from the dealer
= synonyms: draw poker
- in American football, the quarterback moves back as if to pass and then hands the ball to the fullback who is running toward the line of scrimmage
= example: in American football, the quarterback moves back as if to pass and then hands the ball to the fullback who is running toward the line of scrimmage
= synonyms: draw play
- a golf shot that curves to the left for a right-handed golfer
= synonyms: hook
- a playing card or cards dealt or taken from the pack
= example: a playing card or cards dealt or taken from the pack
- anything (straws or pebbles etc.) taken or chosen at random
= example: anything (straws or pebbles etc.) taken or chosen at random
= synonyms: lot
- the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
= example: the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided
= synonyms: standoff, tie
- a gully that is shallower than a ravine
- an entertainer who attracts large audiences
= example: an entertainer who attracts large audiences
= synonyms: drawing card, attraction, attractor, attracter
